content: the small viking cable and knit round 1 and 2 once more but stopping on the last round 3 sts before the back needle in a k2 heel now the heel is prepared make 1 sts by picking up a sts from between the k2 and knitting it turned this picked up sts is the first on the heel flap now knit the following k1 p2 k2 p2 1/2prc 2/1plc p2 1/2prc 2/1plc p2 k2 p2 k1 make1 =30sts the part in the first corresponds to line e in the pattern diagram for a2 or b2 heel is now worked over these 30 sts for 19 more row =20 row in total remember to k1 for the fist and last sts on all row excluding the first and last sts all sts are worked as they show =ribbing turn the heel 1 row k18 ssk k1 turn the work 2 row sl1 p5 p2to p1 turn the work 3 row sl1 knit to last sts before gap ssk the sts before and after the gap k1 turn the work 4 row sl1 purl to last sts before gap p2to the sts before and after the gap p1 turn the work repeat row 3 and 4 untill all sts are worked 18sts left on needle foot pick 11 sts up at each side of the heel = 76 84 sts keep working the big viking cable diagram a1 or b1 on the front of the sock and let the ribbing from the side sts continue as well knit in plain k the back and picked up sts 2 decrease 1 at each side of the sock in the picked up sts nearest the cable = 2 sts every other round until you have 66 70 sts on the needles thus 5 7 times work until foot part of sock is 1½ shorter than the desired footlength it needs to just about reach your pinkie toe now work the toe note there are several possible ways to finish this sock either you can let the cable continue while decreasing perhaps letting it end in a tip row 10 in the diagram or you can stop the cable after a full repeat and work row e in the diagram and then knit ribbing to the toe this is done with the socks in the picture you can also choose to end the cable altogether and work in plain knit the rest of the way because of this i only give directions for the decreases find the sides of the sock this should be 16 17 sts after and before mid heel this leaves 2 more sts on the front than the back and mark them note you can also choose to put the decreases on either side of one of the k2 ribbings running the length of the foot round 1 work to 3 sts before mark k2to k1 slip marker k1 ssk work to 3 before next mark k2to k1 slip marker
